data.title: Arthur Hill students attend 'Life After the Hill' college and career fair
data.meta_description: Over 500 Arthur Hill High School students attended a college and career fair on Thursday, Feb. 18, 2016, the theme of which was "Life After the Hill," in the school's gymnasium in Saginaw, Michigan.
data.text:
SAGINAW, MI - Over 500 Arthur Hill High School students attended a college and career fair on Thursday, Feb. 18, in the school's gymnasium, the theme of which was "Life After the Hill."

Businesses from the Great Lakes Bay Region as well as Michigan colleges and universities sent representatives to discuss opportunities with the students and answer their questions.

Half of the students also listened keynote speaker Dr. Pamela Ross McClain, advisor and assistant professor of education at the University of Michigan-Flint.

Dayna R. Jones, college and career advisor at Arthur Hill, was pleased with the students' engagement during the event.

"This event was an awesome success and our expectations were definitely exceeded. The students were engaging, well behaved, and presented themselves very well," said Jones.
